article.headline: Creighton 72, George Mason 52
article.story: FAIRFAX, Va. (AP) -- Nate Funk, Johnny Mathies and Nick Porter each had 12 points as Creighton beat George Mason 72-52 Tuesday night in the first-ever meeting between the two schools. Creighton (2-0) scored 26 points off turnovers, with 13 steals. The Bluejays held the Patriots (1-2) to 29.1 percent shooting on the night. Tony Skinn and Folarin Campbell each had 14 points for the Patriots. Jai Lewis had a career-high 17 rebounds. Creighton's bench outscored George Mason's 32-6, helped by Porter's 12 and 8 points from Dustin Sitzmann. Creighton took the lead early in the first half and never looked back. The Patriots were held scoreless for the last 1:46.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
